was indicated, There were only two instances cf special expenditures
for music. These range from $2,50 to $5.00.
Program art was mostly indicated as being produced by th©
students and staff, and nearly all costs were for materials* Th©
costs of materials ranged from $5*00 to $150*00 with most costs
reported averaging between $5,00 and $10,00 per program. This is
another instance of the possibility of hidden costs as most of
the work involved in thi3 department would take a great deal of
staff time and effort. However, it is only fair to note that in
many instances an elaborate piece of art work may be used and refused
many times with slight modification, thereby reducing the present
program costs.
Most talent was reported as being donated. The largest cost
in this department was apparently for transportation and food.
However, some instances were reported where faculty members received
as high as $25*00 per program for their efforts. These were rare
instances and usually involved a great deal of effort on th© part
of the faculty member. In other instances faculty members were
reported as having their work equalized by dropping classes or taking
time off from other assignments * but in most instances the efforts
of the faculty were considered as a donation from the institution to
the total effort of educational broadcasting. There were some
programs which required hired dancers (professionals) - it was indicated
that such professionals cost $25*00 each per program.
